intro: Anogra violacea, commonly known as the violet anogra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which are typically trumpet-shaped. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Anogra violacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
